ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A greater understanding of Latin American culture, expanded grammar and vocabulary, and more confidence in speaking publicly in Spanish.
I developed some knowledge of the Spanish language, but not anything I hadn't already learned in L2 Spanish at Yale.
By taking this course I became more proficient in speaking, writing, and interpreting the Spanish Language.
I improved speaking, writing, and reading skills throughout this course. I also grew confidence in my speaking both inside and outside the classroom. I greatly improved my grammatical skills as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class is a complete review of 120, and yet I did worse in 130 than 120.

I enjoyed the consistent homework assignments - relatively short but assigned on a day-to-day basis. The class environment is welcoming. 

There could be more clarity around projects and homework assignments. It wasn't always clear what we were supposed to be doing. Additionally, class often ran late so explanations of homework and projects were rushed.

There were virtually no strengths besides the ELCs. I thought the ELC options were fun and engaging and I'm ultimately glad I was forced to do them, but they were also a great source of stress.
The course material and the way this class deals with topics like race is a huge weakness. A lot of the material was very focused on white Hispanic people, and when anything was focused on Indigenous people or Black people, it was in a negative way. The short "La Noche Boca Arriba" was, frankly, awful to watch. There was an Indigenous person in my class who visibly was uncomfortable with the short film, and I later learned from her that our professor had used the word "indio" to refer to Indigenous people, which is apparently a slur. Our professor didn't even mention this until we watched "Tambien la lluvia", which used the word in the movie. I can't remember a singular time we talked about Afro-Latine culture in class--it was completely focused on the white aspects of Latin America and Spain.
One of the weaknesses is the lack of support for the completion of ongoing projects to ensure that students are not heavily penalized for their earnest attempts.

This course had a wide variety of topics and content which were all very interesting and informative. I appreciated that the course also had Wednesdays as asynchronous learning as I think it was helpful to learn and engage with the language in a different light. However, the daily workload often took much more time than expected.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This class was a strain on my mental health, but I mean if you have to take it you have to take it.
Yes, language courses should be relatively rigorous. I also really enjoyed my professor - Juliana Ramos-Ruano.

I would not recommend this course if you are not white. The course material in itself tends to at best leave out POC and at worst demean POC. Of course, if you're taking this, you're probably taking it because you are trying to fulfill the language requirement that Yale has. In that case, I would recommend not taking it with Juliana Ramos-Ruano, because she is not a good communicator and will make this class harder than it needs to be.
I would recommend this course to another student who wants to develop their skills in Spanish in a healthy learning environment.
I would recommend this course to another student as it is very helpful to improve your Spanish skills; however, it is a large commitment.
